result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Dewitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall undergo anger management/domestic violence counseling and follow through as directed.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Jason C. Dewitt in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. wants to talk to DA about the offer; JT remains; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, SMD, w/f dob 6/8/81 or her residence.  The parties may communicate through a third party for child exchange purposes ONLY.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 105 Knaup Drive, #8, Beaver Dam, WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

(12:46) Defendant Jason C. Dewitt in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (jail only).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. State heard on bond, $2,000 Cash w/conditions; Atty. Button response; RD 2/22/16 at 3:30pm & JT 4/6/16 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000.00 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, S.M.D., w/f dob 6/8/81 or her residence at 105 Knaupp Drive, #8, Beaver Dam, WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property. The parties may communicate through a third party for child exchange purposes ONLY. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety   and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
